document.discussion_title: JAKKS Pacific’s (JAKK) “Buy” Rating Reaffirmed at BMO Capital Markets
document.topic_text: Tweet JAKKS Pacific, Inc. (NASDAQ:JAKK) ‘s stock had its “buy” rating restated by equities research analysts at BMO Capital Markets in a research report issued on Monday, AnalystRatings.Net reports. A number of hedge funds and institutional investors have recently made changes to their positions in the company. HighPoint Advisor Group LLC boosted its position in shares of JAKKS Pacific by 28.3% in the fourth quarter. HighPoint Advisor Group LLC now owns 97,808 shares of the company’s stock valued at $718,000 after buying an additional 21,581 shares during the period. Acadian Asset Management LLC raised its stake in JAKKS Pacific by 18.2% in the first quarter. Acadian Asset Management LLC now owns 830,449 shares of the company’s stock worth $6,178,000 after buying an additional 127,907 shares in the last quarter. True Bearing Asset Management LP raised its stake in JAKKS Pacific by 16.9% in the fourth quarter. True Bearing Asset Management LP now owns 153,903 shares of the company’s stock worth $1,225,000 after buying an additional 22,200 shares in the last quarter. D. E. Shaw & Co. Inc. raised its stake in JAKKS Pacific by 60.8% in the fourth quarter. D. E. Shaw & Co. Inc. now owns 171,199 shares of the company’s stock worth $1,363,000 after buying an additional 64,763 shares in the last quarter. Finally, Cooper Creek Partners Management LLC raised its stake in JAKKS Pacific by 109.6% in the fourth quarter. Cooper Creek Partners Management LLC now owns 674,246 shares of the company’s stock worth $5,367,000 after buying an additional 352,526 shares in the last quarter. In other news, CEO Stephen G. Berman acquired 5,000 shares of the company’s stock in a transaction that occurred on Monday, February 29th. The shares were bought at an average price of $6.94 per share, with a total value of $34,700.00. The transaction was disclosed in a filing with the Securities & Exchange Commission, which can be accessed through this link . Also, major shareholder Patrick Soon-Shiong sold 1,000,000 shares of the stock in a transaction that occurred on Thursday, March 3rd. The stock was sold at an average price of $7.45, for a total value of $7,450,000.00. Following the completion of the transaction, the insider now directly owns 239,622 shares in the company, valued at approximately $1,785,183.90. The disclosure for this sale can be found here . JAKKS Pacific ( NASDAQ:JAKK ) traded down 0.54% on Monday, reaching $7.39. 78,193 shares of the company’s stock were exchanged. The company has a market cap of $138.79 million and a price-to-earnings ratio of 10.41. The stock’s 50 day moving average is $7.38 and its 200 day moving average is $7.63. JAKKS Pacific has a 52 week low of $6.17 and a 52 week high of $10.28. JAKKS Pacific (NASDAQ:JAKK) last posted its earnings results on Thursday, April 21st. The company reported ($1.01) EPS for the quarter, missing the Zacks’ consensus estimate of ($0.94) by $0.07. The business earned $95.80 million during the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $98 million. The company’s quarterly revenue was down 16.1% on a year-over-year basis. During the same period last year, the firm posted ($0.40) earnings per share. On average, equities analysts anticipate that JAKKS Pacific will post $0.76 earnings per share for the current year. Other analysts have also issued research reports about the company. B. Riley reaffirmed a “neutral” rating and issued a $8.25 price objective on shares of JAKKS Pacific in a report on Friday. Piper Jaffray reaffirmed a “buy” rating on shares of JAKKS Pacific in a report on Tuesday, February 23rd. Finally, Zacks Investment Research raised JAKKS Pacific from a “hold” rating to a “buy” rating and set a $7.50 price objective for the company in a report on Friday, February 26th. One investment analyst has rated the stock with a sell rating, two have assigned a hold rating and four have given a buy rating to the stock. The company currently has an average rating of “Hold” and an average target price of $10.53. JAKKS Pacific, Inc ( NASDAQ:JAKK ) is a multi-line, multi-brand toy company that designs, produces, markets and distributes toys and related products, pet toys, consumables and related products, electronics and related products, kids indoor and outdoor furniture, and other consumer products. //www.americanbankingnews.com/2016/04/25/jakks-pacifics-jakk-buy-rating-reaffirmed-at-bmo-capital-markets/ JAKKS Pacific Inc. JAKKS Pacific Inc.
